programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Utes and Red Storm meet on the hardwood for the first time in a Charleston Classic third-place game. Utah fell 76-66 to No. 6 Houston in the semifinals despite Gabe Madsen's career-high 29 points. St. John's coughed up a halftime lead to Dayton.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Flyers seek an upset of the No. 6 Cougars in the Charleston Classic championship game. DaRon Holmes II scored 21 points in Dayton's semifinal win over St. John's. Houston is off to its fourth 5-0 start in six seasons after dispatching Utah.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 20 Tar Heels (8-2, 4-2 ACC) visit Death Valley to tangle with the Tigers (6-4, 3-4). Clemson has won five straight meetings, including 39-10 in the 2022 ACC championship game. North Carolina comes off a 47-45 victory over Duke in double OT.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Monday Blitz
programme.desc: A fast-paced offering that blends the NFL and college football while focusing on the weekend that was and broader topics; includes moments and significant achievements from all levels of football, such as high school, youth and flag football.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. Host Scott Van Pelt is joined by Ryan Clark, Robert Griffin III, Marcus Spears, Adam Schefter and Michelle Beisner-Buck as they analyze every last morsel of information pertaining to Monday night's combatants, plus discuss the latest news that developed out of Sunday's action.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Eagles (8-1) fly into Arrowhead Stadium to take on the Chiefs (7-2) in a Super Bowl 57 rematch. Both teams were off last week. Patrick Mahomes rallied Kansas City to a 38-35 victory over Philadelphia en route to winning his second Super Bowl MVP.

programme.title: Monday Night Postgame
programme.desc: A recap of the Monday Night Football matchup with highlights, interviews and more.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Catamounts and Flames play for the Myrtle Beach Invitational title. Both schools are unbeaten at 4-0. Liberty's Kyle Rode has totaled 50 points through tournament victories over Furman and Wichita State. Vermont topped Charleston and Saint Louis.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Shockers and the Billikens play for third place at the Myrtle Beach Invitational. Both clubs fell to 4-1 as their perfect seasons ended in semifinal losses Nov. 17. Wichita State last went up against Saint Louis in 2016, winning 75-45.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Huskies (3-1) and Aztecs (3-1) face off in the Continental Tire Main Event final from Las Vegas. In one semifinal, Washington repelled a challenge from Xavier 74-71, while San Diego State smoked Saint Mary's 79-54 behind Jaedon LeDee's 25 points.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special: My Wish
programme.desc: Athletes work with Make-A-WishÂ® to fulfill sports-themed wishes for children with critical illness.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: A first of its kind medical procedure kept her alive, but it was a promise to run again with her hero that gave her hope.

programme.title: PFL Battle Lines with Dan Hardy
programme.desc: Dan Hardy discusses Professional Fighters League action.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: No. 14 Oklahoma heads west to play BYU. The schools last met in 2009, when the Cougars knocked reigning Heisman Trophy winner and Oklahoma quarterback Sam Bradford out of the game en route to a season-opening, 14-13 upset of the No. 3 Sooners.

programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Rebels (4-1) challenge the Wolverines (4-0) in the Battle 4 Atlantis championship game. Taylor Williams put up 19 points and 18 rebounds to lead Michigan past South Dakota in the semifinals. Ole Miss knocked off Arizona to advance.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Syracuse tries to stay perfect at the Maui Invitational in this first-round game with Tennessee. The Orange are 9-0 all-time in tournament play, coming away with Maui titles in 1990, 1998 and 2013. Both programs enter this contest with a 3-0 record.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Ranked teams showcase in this first-round Maui Invitational contest between Purdue and Gonzaga. The Bulldogs possess a shiny 11-4 record in Maui tournament play, taking home titles in 2009 and 2018. Zach Edey (PUR) is averaging 20.7 points per game.

programme.desc: A marquee first-round Maui Invitational showing pits the Bruins against the Golden Eagles. Adem Bona's 18 points per game has led UCLA to a 3-0 start. Marquette is also 3-0 after beating then-No. 23 Illinois behind 24 points from Tyler Kolek.

programme.desc: UFC legend Daniel Cormier and Super Bowl champion, Ryan Clark, both Louisiana natives, hang out and kick around the hottest topics from across the world of MMA and preview/review the most important fight cards and storylines.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: John T. Edge travels around the region, introducing viewers to Southern tastemakers, food, culture and history as they intertwine in the beautiful yet complex South.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: College Football Playoff: Top 25
programme.desc: College football's top teams are debated and discussed in anticipation of the College Football Playoff Selection Committee's first meeting. Rece Davis hosts with analysis from David Pollack, Joey Galloway and Kirk Herbstreit.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special: My Wish
programme.desc: Athletes work with Make-A-WishÂ® to fulfill sports-themed wishes for children with critical illness.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: From Stan Sheriff Center in Honolulu.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Men's college basketball action.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Caitlin Clark's No. 2 Hawkeyes (3-1) seek a bounce-back effort when they host the Bulldogs (3-0). Iowa fell victim to Ayoka Lee's upstart Kansas State squad 65-58 for its first loss of the season Nov. 16, with Clark shooting 9-of-32 from the field.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 8 Huskies visit the Golden Gophers. Minnesota is 3-0 for the first time in five years, by a combined 115 points. Golden Gophers 6-foot sophomore guard Mara Braun, an all-Big Ten preseason team selection, is averaging 21 points per game.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 7 Longhorns try to lock up a spot in the Big 12 title game when they visit the Cyclones. Texas, who remains a darkhorse for the College Football Playoff, owns the outright conference lead after surviving a furious comeback at TCU in Week 11.

programme.title: The Joel Klatt Show: Big Noon Conversations
programme.desc: Joel Klatt sits down to discuss the 2023 season with some of NCAA football's most prominent coaches and commissioners.

programme.title: UEFA European Qualifiers Matchnight Highlights
programme.desc: Soccer highlights from the UEFA European Qualifiers.

programme.title: 2023 FIFA U-17 World Cup
programme.desc: From Manahan Stadium, in Surakarta, Jawa Tengah, Indonesia.

programme.title: The Joel Klatt Show: Big Noon Conversations
programme.desc: Joel Klatt sits down to discuss the 2023 season with some of NCAA football's most prominent coaches and commissioners.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Blake Corum and the No. 3 Wolverines (10-0, 7-0 Big Ten) visit the Terrapins (6-4, 3-4). Michigan has won 10 of 11 meetings. The 5-foot-8 Corum leads the nation in scoring with 18 touchdowns after going in twice during a 24-15 triumph at Penn State.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: Undisputed
programme.desc: A daily sports talk show hosted by Skip Bayless, where each day Skip is joined by a cast of NFL legends for passionate conversations about the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard and Kevin Wildes explore and energetically advance the biggest stories in sports to start the day.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Opinions and predictions for happenings in the NFL.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Cavaliers go up against the Badgers in a Fort Myers Tip-Off semifinal. Virginia moved to 4-0 by beating Texas Southern on Nov. 16. Wisconsin leveled its record at 2-2 by topping Robert Morris behind 18 bench points from John Blackwell on Nov. 17.

programme.title: FS1 College Hoops Extra
programme.desc: Highlights and analysis of today's college basketball action.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Mountaineers (2-1) square off with the Mustangs (3-1) in the Fort Myers Tip-Off semifinal round. This is the first meeting between the two schools. Texas native and Iona transfer Quinn Slazinski leads West Virginia with 17.3 points per game.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA Euro Qualifying
programme.desc: Group C.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Bo Nix and the No. 6 Ducks (9-1, 6-1 Pac-12) visit the Sun Devils (3-7, 2-5). Nix, a co-favorite to win the Heisman Trophy, completes 77.7% of his passes, 29 for touchdowns, against two interceptions. The 23-year-old has also rushed for five scores.
